2 Day Hui Nam Dang Hilltribe Trail and Bamboo Rafting

Join us to the beautiful Hui Nam Dang National Park and hike scenic trails through the rainforest and jungles of the North. Passing through and sleeping in rural hilltribe villages and experiencing a rural way of life. Along the trail you will get to see buffalo and bamboo raft down the Mae Tang river. This trail is perfect for families with young and older children.

Quick Facts

Price: THB 3,500
Duration: 1 night 2 days
Meal(s): Meals
Difficulty: All levels
Seasonal: November - February

More Info

Pick Up & Drop Off

Pick up around 8:30, arriving in the city around 16.30 to 17.30

Included

Meals, Water (Only on the first day), Blanket, Mosquito Net, Mattress

Not Included

Extra snacks or soft drinks.

What to Bring

Wear shoes with grip suitable for trekking and climbing, swimsuit for enjoying at the waterfall and pack a warm layer, mornings can be chilly at the summit.

Please support our mission by booking your trek directly with us on this site or by calling us instead of through a tour agency.

Highlights

  • Explore Hui Nam Dang National Park
  • Stay at Hilltribe Villages
  • Get to know Water buffalo
  • Enjoy the beauty of Mork Fa Waterfall
  • Have fun on Bamboo rafting

Itinerary:

  • Day 1: 08:30 AM we will pick you up at your hotel in Chiang Mai and will then do a 40 minute drive to a domestic market where we spend approx. 20 minutes to gather provisions for the tour.
  • Another 30 minute drive on the domestic route along a steep road will bring us to Mork Fa waterfall where you can swim in this relaxing place with wonderful views.
  • After visiting the waterfall and a short drive later you will have lunch and some time to rest alongside the road in a small restaurant. We will do the cooking for you and you can enjoy your first authentic Thai-Food prepared by us.
  • After lunch and another 45-60 minutes drive by car we will reach the drop-off and here the trekking part of your tour will begin and you will enter the dense jungle with us.
  • We will hike approximately 3 to 4 hours, enjoying the Rainforest and nature of the North, passing through Baan Pong Noi Karen Village and then hiking deeper into the National Park. Along the way we will see buffalo and maybe even more nature if you Arriving Mae Ma Nai Karen Village, where we will stay the night in a homestay and your guide will cook you a delicious dinner which you can help prepare if you want. This is a small village with about 20 houses. You will get to see a very rural way of life and how the locals live in the rainforest. The village is at an altitude of about 1,400 meters above sea level. You can walk around the village and enjoy the evening scene of the surrounding mountains. Among other things you can see the top of Thailands 3rd highest mountain, Doi Chiang Dao.
  • Day 2: Wake up and have breakfast. After breakfast we will be leaving the Karen village and hike for approximately 1 to 2 hours to the Mae Tang River, here we will prepare our bamboo rafts on which we will raft down the river for approximately 2 to 3 hours. Each bamboo raft has a rack in the middle for luggage which keeps it dry. You will enjoy the scenic views while we raft down the river and enjoy the nature from all around you. If you like the guide can show you how to steer the raft. (It is not so easy)
  • We will finally reach Sopkhai village, you can refresh yourself and will have lunch and you can wander around the small village and across a long wooden hanging bridge and we will then head back to Chiang Mai, arriving in the city around 16.30 to 17.30

Notes:

Trails may very during different seasons and be slippery in rainy season. If the river is too high and dangerous bamboo rafting will not be an option. It is also possible to have only walk trails and harder trails on request.
